function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Increased interaction and communication through social media platforms can lead to the rapid spread of misinformation about contagious diseases and their prevention.","Impact":"Misinformation can lead to poor decision-making, non-compliance with safety measures, and increased risk of disease spread.","Mitigation":"Implement fact-checking processes, provide reliable sources of information, and promote critical thinking skills among platform users.","Technologies":"AI-driven content moderation, fact-checking plugins, and data analysis algorithms to identify misinformation trends.","People":"General public, healthcare workers, and policymakers","Owner":"Platform administrators, public health authorities, and government agencies"},{"Description":"The cancellation of educational activities, such as conferences and training courses, reduces opportunities for healthcare professionals to learn about new developments in disease prevention, diagnosis, and treatment.","Impact":"Lack of access to educational events can hinder the dissemination of crucial information, best practices, and advancements in healthcare.","Mitigation":"Develop virtual educational platforms, offer online training programs, and facilitate remote learning opportunities for healthcare professionals.","Technologies":"Virtual reality (VR) training simulations, online conference platforms, and interactive e-learning modules.","People":"Healthcare professionals, medical students, and researchers","Owner":"Medical associations, educational institutions, and healthcare organizations"}]}
